Package de.neo.jagil.gui

Class GUI

java.lang.Object
de.neo.jagil.gui.GUI
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConfirmGUI
public abstract class GUI extends Object
Represents a GUI. Extend this class to create your own GUI with JAGIL.
Version:
2.0
Author:
Neo8

  • Constructor Details

    • GUI

      public GUI​(String name, int size)
      Creates a new instance of the GUI class. Use this constructor when you like to create a universal GUI with a specific size.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the Inventory
      size - size of the Inventory

    • GUI

      @UnstableFeature public GUI​(String name, org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryType type)
      Creates a new instance of the GUI class. Use this constructor when you like to create a universal GUI with a specific InventoryType.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the Inventory
      type - InventoryType of the Inventory

    • GUI

      public GUI​(String name, int size, org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer p)
      Creates a new instance of the GUI class. Use this constructor when you like to create a non-universal GUI with a specific size.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the Inventory
      size - size of the Inventory
      p - the Player that should see this Inventory.

    • GUI

      @UnstableFeature public GUI​(String name, org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryType type, org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer p)
      Creates a new instance of the GUI class. Use this constructor when you like to create a non-universal GUI with a specific size.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the Inventory
      type - InventoryType of the Inventory
      p - the Player that should see this Inventory.

      public String getName()

    • getSize

      public int getSize()

      @Internal(forVisibilityChange=false) public String getIdentifier()

    • getPlayerUUID

      public UUID getPlayerUUID()

      public org.bukkit.entity.Player getPlayer()

    • getInventory

      public org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory getInventory()

    • update

      @Internal(forVisibilityChange=true) public GUI update()
      This method is called to create an Inventory. This is called by show() automatically.
      Returns:
      instance for chaining

    • show

      public GUI show()
      Call this method to open the inventory of a non-universal GUI.
      Returns:
      instance for chaining
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the internal Player is null or this is used on a universal GUI

    • show

      public GUI show​(org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer p)
      Call this method to open the Inventory of a universal GUI for a specific Player.
      Parameters:
      p - player that should see the Inventory
      Returns:
      instance for chaining

    • fill

      public abstract GUI fill()
      Fills this GUI
      Returns:
      instance for chaining

    • handle

      public abstract boolean handle​(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent e)
      Called on an InventoryClickEvent in this Inventory.
      Parameters:
      e - the fired InventoryClickEvent
      Returns:
      if the event should be cancelled or not.

    • handleLast

      @OptionalImplementation public GUI handleLast​(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent e)
      Like handle(InventoryClickEvent) but optional and one tick later.
      Parameters:
      e - the fired InventoryClickEvent
      Returns:
      instance for chaining

    • handleDrag

      @OptionalImplementation public boolean handleDrag​(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryDragEvent e)
      Called on an InventoryDragEvent in this Inventory.
      Parameters:
      e - the fired InventoryDragEvent
      Returns:
      if the event should be cancelled or not.

    • handleDragLast

      @OptionalImplementation public GUI handleDragLast​(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryDragEvent e)
      Like handleDrag(InventoryDragEvent) but optional and one tick later.
      Parameters:
      e - the fired InventoryClickEvent
      Returns:
      instance for chaining

    • handleClose

      @OptionalImplementation public GUI handleClose​(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryCloseEvent e)
      Like handleDrag(InventoryDragEvent) but optional and one tick later.
      Parameters:
      e - the fired InventoryClickEvent
      Returns:
      instance for chaining

    • isCancelledByDefault

      @OptionalImplementation public boolean isCancelledByDefault()
      Returns if the event should cancelled by default.
      Returns:
      the default cancel-value
